summary: A federal court subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to AT&T, commanding the company to appear and produce phone records for a specific number from 1999-2004 for the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: Issued the subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which the subpoena is issued to obtain phone records.

connections.description: Williams, as U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Subpoena Compliance Date
events.description: AT&T is commanded to appear in court to testify and produce phone records for a specific number from 1999-2004.

locations: 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 318, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
AT&T Global Legal Demands Center, 11760 U.S. Highway 1, Suite 300, North Palm Beach, FL 33408
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks phone records (subscriber, billing, call detail, toll) for a specific number from 1999-2004.
The records are sought for the criminal prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell (case 20 Cr. 330).
Failure to comply constitutes contempt of court with civil and criminal penalties.
The subpoena was issued by U.S. Attorney Damian Williams on November 11, 2021.
The requested appearance and production date was set for November 29, 2021, at 9:00 a.m.
